column4: I'd go with grub. I haven't seen a bios intelligent enough to load several os's.

no issue, it´s just that i don´t need it... my bios wont let me choose various oses, but would allow me to correctly choose the device which I want to boot... if i have only one os per device, no problem in using the mbr to boot the first poartition on each one
grub has additional uses though. You can easily recover broken linux installations as well
the "broken linux installation" will be on a sd card... it is much easir just to get the sd card out of the reader, um recover it from a running installation
